fields.actionDescription:
• Start with the involved arm extended down at the hip.
• Move the involved arm forward while maintaining an extended state.
• Ensure that the thumb is pointed upwards to the ceiling as you move your involved arm. 
• Once you reach your maximum range of motion, return to the starting position to complete one rep.
fields.name: Shoulder Flexion (Single), Side-Facing

fields.actionDescription:
• Drop the involved arm off the side so that it hangs down. 
• Begin the movement by activating the scapula and packing it back in toward the spine for joint stability.
• Row the involved arm up toward the ceiling till it is at least 90 degrees at the elbow.
• Pause slightly then return to the starting position for the completion of a rep.
fields.name: Row - Prone with Weights, Side-Facing

fields.actionDescription:
• Start from a “modified high plank”; arms straight, hands slightly wider than shoulder width, shoulders above wrists, core engaged, knees bent to 90 degrees so feet are off the floor.
• Keep shoulders, hips, and knees in line as your slowly lower your chest toward the floor while bending your elbows.
• Keep your elbows just slightly off your body to avoid them from flaring out.
• Stop at your desired height based on ability.
• Push back up to the starting position for the completion of a rep.
fields.name: Push-Ups on Knees, Side-Facing

fields.actionDescription:
• Elbow in as close to the ribs as possible, maintaining that throughout the duration of the exercise. 
• Keep the arm bent at 90 degrees (whether holding weight or band), and bring the hand/arm in towards the midline of the body and then slowly bring it back to the start.
fields.name: Internal Shoulder Rotation

fields.actionDescription:
• Rest your head into the forearm of your uninvolved arm.
• Straighten the involved arm so that the hand is by the hip with the thumb pointing down toward the ground. 
• Make sure the weight used is manageable before attempting a rep. 
• Maintain an extended arm as you move it up toward the ceiling. 
• Move till there is slight tension but no pain.
• Return to the starting position for the completion of a rep.
fields.name: Shoulder Extension - Prone with Weights, Side-Facing

fields.actionDescription:
• Slide the elbow of the involved side out so that it is aligned with the shoulder while maintaining contact with the ground at all times.
• Slowly lower the hand toward the feet while keeping the elbow pivoted on the ground. 
• Complete the downward range and return to the 90 degree starting position for the completion of a rep. 
• Minor tension is okay but there should not be any pain associated with this movement.
fields.name: Internal Shoulder Abduction/Rotation at 90° - ROM, Side-Facing

fields.actionDescription:
• The uninvolved leg can be bent at that knee with the foot flat on the ground. 
• Roll up a towel or use a soft pillow and place it underneath the achilles/heel area of the involved leg. 
• This will keep the involved leg elevated so that there is a bridge effect at the knee joint. 
• With the involved leg activated, try and touch the ground with the bottom of the involved knee, promoting extension at the joint. 
• Tension is okay but pain is not. 
• Return to the activated, slightly bent knee position and repeat.
fields.name: Terminal Knee Extension - Supine, Side-Facing

fields.actionDescription:
• The uninvolved leg can be bent at that knee with the foot flat on the ground. 
• Carefully straighten the involved leg out so that it is out in front.
• Remove any shoe or slipper that may add friction to the movement. 
• Start by flexing the toes of the involved leg toward the shin and slide the heel toward your butt. 
• Promote as much range of motion as possible.
• Returning to the starting position for the completion of a rep.
fields.name: Heel Slides - Supine, Side-Facing

fields.actionDescription:
• Wrap the theraband to a lower anchor point. 
• You can use your foot as an anchor point. 
• Start the involved arm with a small bend at the elbow and slightly out in front of the body. 
• Raise the arm up laterally while maintaining the bent position to a point of tension but not pain. 
• Return to starting position for the completion of a rep.
fields.name: Diagonal Up with Theraband

fields.actionDescription:
• The working arm should be bent at 90 degrees at the elbow with the hand starting from the mid-section. 
• Begin to externally rotate the shoulder moving the arm away from the mid section maintaining the 90 degree joint angle at the elbow. 
• Rotate the arm till there is slight tension and then slowly rotate back to mid-section, indicating one rep.
fields.name: External Shoulder Rotation

fields.actionDescription:
• Looping the theraband around your forward foot and enter into a hinge position. 
• Retract both elbows up toward the ceiling and match the height of the ribs. 
• Maintain this position while you pivot underneath the elbow and extending the arms out behind you. 
• Try your best to get to full extension with both arms. 
• Return to the starting position for the completion of a rep.
fields.name: Tricep Extension with Theraband (Bilateral), Side-Facing
External Rotation Stretch with Cane, Side-Facing
Shoulder Wall Slides with Theraband, Side-Facing

fields.actionDescription:
• Begin the movement by raising the involved arm up and across the body.
• Move the hand and theraband up towards the opposite shoulder in a diagonal motion. 
• Hold at the top for a moment then return to the starting position and repeat.
fields.name: PNF - D1 Diagonal Lifts with Theraband

fields.actionDescription:
• With your arms in a T position, initiate the movement by pressing both arms out and in. 
• Keep a slight bend in your elbows and round your shoulder blades as if you were trying to reach around a tree. 
• Hold for a moment then return to the starting position and repeat.
fields.name: Dynamic Hug with Theraband
Shoulder Flexion to 90º - Supine with Theraband (Single), Side-Facing

fields.actionDescription:
• Initiate the movement by squeezing your shoulder blades down and back. 
• Pull through your elbows and bring the band towards your rib cage. 
• While maintaining good posture and a neutral spine. 
• Hold for a moment, then return to the starting position and repeat.
fields.name: Row - Standing with Theraband, Side-Facing

fields.actionDescription:
• Anchor the theraband at head height or higher. 
• Keep your shoulder activated with the elbow pinned to the ribs.
• Pivot around the elbow while driving the hand of the involved arm down toward the ground into extension. 
• Try your best to move through the full range of motion.
• Return to the starting position for the completion of a rep.
fields.name: Tricep Extension with Theraband (Single)

fields.actionDescription:
• Begin the movement by making fist with your involved hand and slowly lift it off the floor. 
• Fully extend your arms as much as possible without pain. 
• Hold for a moment then return to the starting position and repeat.
fields.name: Supine Punch, Side-Facing

fields.actionDescription:
• Connect a theraband to an anchor point roughly at chest to hip height.
• Keep the involved arm in front of the body and rested at 90 degrees at the elbow.
• Holding onto the theraband with your involved arm.
• You might feel minor tension in this position. 
• Start the exercise by maintaining these joint angles while you bring the involved arm back across the body to mid-line. 
• Feel free to bring the forearm all the way in till it touches your mid-section. 
• Return to the starting position for the completion of a rep.
fields.name: Internal Shoulder Rotation with Theraband

fields.actionDescription:
• Grab the theraband from an anchor point out in front of you. 
• For the starting position, keep the hands out in front of the body while gripping the band, shoulders packed and activated at the shoulder blades. 
• Move the arms together up in the "T" position while maintaining the shoulder activation and body position. 
• Return to the starting position for the completion of a rep.
fields.name: Standing T with Theraband with Anchor Point (Bilateral)

fields.actionDescription:
• Grab the theraband from an anchor point out in front of you. 
• For the starting position, keep the hands out in front of the body while gripping the band, shoulders packed and activated at the shoulder blades. 
• Move the arms together up in the "I" position while maintaining the shoulder activation and body position. 
• Return to the starting position for the completion of a rep.
fields.name: Standing I with Theraband with Anchor Point

fields.actionDescription:
• Begin the movement by bending at the knee moving your heel towards your glutes. 
• Bend as far as possible while maintaining thigh contact to the floor.
• You should feel a stretch in front of your leg and knee. 
• Return leg back to starting position and repeat.
fields.name: Knee Flexion - Prone, Side-Facing

fields.actionDescription:
• Drop the involved arm off the side so that it hangs down. 
• Begin the movement by activating the scapula and packing it back in toward the spine for joint stability. 
• Row the involved arm up toward the ceiling till at least 90 degrees at the elbow.
• Pause slightly then return to the starting position for the completion of a rep.
fields.name: Row - Prone, Side-Facing

fields.actionDescription:
• Grab the theraband from an anchor point out in front of you. 
• For the starting position, keep the hands out in front of the body while gripping the band, shoulders packed and activated at the shoulder blades. 
• Move the arms together up in the "Y" position while maintaining the shoulder activation and body position. 
• Return to the starting position for the completion of a rep.
fields.name: Standing Y with Theraband with Anchor Point

fields.actionDescription:
• Stand tall side facing to the camera, with feet shoulder width apart and firmly rooted into the ground, engage your core to initiate the movement.
• Slowly lift your leg closest to the camera, allowing your knee to bend, until you reach 90 degrees of hip flexion, or your available pain-free range of motion.
• Focus on engaging the core and hip muscles of your stance leg for improved balance.
• Pause one second at the top and then return to your starting position.
• A rep will count when you are standing at starting position with both feet on the floor.
fields.name: Hip Flexion to 90º - Standing, Side-Facing

fields.actionDescription:
• Put both hands behind the head or put your fingers up by your ears.
• Push the elbows back as if you were attempting to touch a wall behind you. 
• Engage the core, and keep the feet rooted to ground so that you feel a strong, stable foundation. 
• Initiate the movement by setting the hips back over the heels as you squat down. 
• A recommended range of motion is getting your butt to knee height. 
• Maintain a long forward spine angle with a fixed gaze roughly 45 degrees out in front of you. 
• Return to the starting position for the completion of a rep.
fields.name: Squat (Prisoner), Side-Facing

fields.actionDescription:
• Put both hands behind the head or put your fingers up by your ears.
• Push the elbows back as if you were attempting to touch a wall behind you. 
• Engage the core, and keep the feet rooted to ground so that you feel a strong, stable foundation. 
• Initiate the movement by setting the hips back over the heels as you squat down. 
• A recommended range of motion is getting your butt to knee height. 
• Maintain a long forward spine angle with a fixed gaze roughly 45 degrees out in front of you. 
• Return to the starting position for the completion of a rep.
fields.name: Squat (Prisoner)

fields.actionDescription:
• Begin by standing tall with feet slightly wider than hips and toes facing forward or slightly turned out.
• Initiate the movement by pushing your hips slightly back while bending at the hips and knees until you reach the bottom of your squat.
• Maintain a forward gaze and an upright chest. Weight should be evenly distributed through your entire foot, and on both feet.
• Press through the whole foot while standing back up to starting position.
• A rep will count when you return to your upright starting position.
fields.name: Squat, Side-Facing

fields.actionDescription:
• Bend your knees so the feet are flat on the floor. 
• Keep your arms rested at 45 degrees at your side. 
• Engage the core by driving the belly button down to the floor.
• Initiate the movement by driving the hips upward toward the ceiling, doing your best to engage the glutes. 
• Proceed to the maximum range of motion without overextending. 
• Return to the starting position for the completion of a rep. 
• Pay close attention to the PT’s protocol for tempo, isometric holds, and rep counting.
fields.name: Bridge (Bilateral), Side-Facing

fields.actionDescription:
• Start with the involved arm bent at 90 degrees at the elbow and the forearm positioned across the midline of the body.
• Slowly move the forearm outside the body while maintaining the elbow close to the body. 
• Continue to maximal range of motion then slowly rotate back to the starting position. 
• Minor tension is okay but there should not be any pain associated with this movement.
fields.name: External Shoulder Abduction/Rotation at 0° - ROM

fields.actionDescription:
• Wrap the theraband around both feet with your legs out in front of you. 
• If you are unable to straighten the legs all the way, just keep the heels pinned down to the ground. 
• Maintain an upright posture and pull the band toward you with both arms.
• Keep the elbows locked to the ribs and shoulder blades actively retracted. 
• Pull the theraband all the way in.
• Slowly release it back to the straight arm starting position for the completion of a rep.
fields.name: Row - Seated with Theraband (Bilateral), Side-Facing

fields.actionDescription:
• Begin the movement by raising your involved knee up, while rotating slightly out. 
• Keep your big toes touching and lift without altering the alignment of your hips.
• Hold at the top and return to starting position and repeat.
fields.name: Clamshell with Pillow - Side Lying

fields.actionDescription:
• Starting in a plank position with your elbows straight, arms slightly wider than shoulder width. Your shoulders should be above your wrist with your core engaged.
• Begin the movement by bending your elbows and slowly lowering your chest to the floor while keeping your shoulder over your wrist, and core engaged.
• Keep your elbows just slightly wider than your body without flaring out.
• Stop at your desired height based on ability.
• A rep will count when you return to the top of your plank.
fields.name: Push-Ups, Side-Facing

fields.actionDescription:
• Rest your head on your non-involved forearm.
• Gently rotate the thumb toward the ground for internal rotation.
• Move the involved arm upwards towards the ceiling till you reach maximum range of motion.
• Minor tension is okay but there should be zero pain associated with the movement.
fields.name: Shoulder Extension - Prone - ROM, Side-Facing

fields.actionDescription:
• Rest your head into the forearm of your uninvolved arm.
• Straighten the involved arm so that the hand is by the hip with the thumb pointing down toward the ground. 
• Maintain an extended arm as you move it up toward the ceiling. 
• Move till there is slight tension but no pain.
• Return to the starting position for the completion of a rep.
fields.name: Shoulder Extension - Prone, Side-Facing

fields.actionDescription:
• Rest your head on a pillow or on the upper portion of your uninvolved arm.
• The involved arm should be at 90 degrees with the elbow tucked into the ribcage. 
• Pivot the elbow from this position so that the wrist moves vertically downwards, creating an external rotation at the shoulder joint.
• Rotate downwards till there is slight tension and slowly come back to the starting position for the completion of one rep.
fields.name: External Shoulder Rotation - Side Lying

fields.actionDescription:
• Rest your head on a pillow or on the upper portion of your uninvolved arm.
• The involved arm should be at 90 degrees with the elbow tucked into the ribcage. 
• Starting from a rested but activated position, pivot around the elbow and move the hand upward toward the ceiling. 
• Do your best to keep the elbow into the ribs and the shoulder set back to maintain activation. 
• Move upward till there is some tension but no pain. 
• Return to the starting position for the completion of a rep.
fields.name: External Rotation - Side-Lying with Weights, Side-Facing

fields.actionDescription:
• The elbow of the involved arm (bottom arm) should be out from the body so that it can be mobile. 
• Use the uninvolved arm (upper arm) to facilitate this internal stretch. 
• Grab the wrist area and gently move theinvolved arm down toward the ground while pivoting at the elbow. 
• It is important to not push too hard or go too far. 
• Tension is alright, pain is not. 
• Return to the top of this movement for completion of a rep.
fields.name: Internal Shoulder Rotation Stretch - Sidelying, Side-Facing

fields.actionDescription:
• Keep the involved arm fully extended and shoulder packed in.
• While keeping the thumb of the involved arm facing up, flex the arm overhead till you reach maximum range of motion. 
• Return back to starting position for the completion of a rep.
fields.name: Shoulder Flexion - Supine - ROM, Side-Facing

fields.actionDescription:
• You will need a dowel or broomstick-like feature in order to facilitate this flexion movement. 
• Once in position, start with both hands shoulder width apart on the dowel positioned at your waistline. 
• Slowly move both arms evenly, asserting a larger percentage of effort via the good side, as you move up and overhead. 
• Move to a position of tension but no pain. 
• Return to the starting position for the completion of a rep.
fields.name: Shoulder Flexion AAROM - Supine with Cane, Side-Facing

fields.actionDescription:
• Slide the elbow of the involved side out so that it is aligned with the shoulder while maintaining contact with the ground at all times.
• Slowly lower the hand down behind you while keeping the elbow pivoted on the ground. 
• Complete the downward range and return to the 90 degree starting position for the completion of a rep. 
• Minor tension is okay but there should not be any pain associated with this movement.
fields.name: External Shoulder Abduction/Rotation at 90° - ROM, Side-Facing

fields.actionDescription:
• To initiate the movement, slowly lower your hand down behind you while keeping the elbow pivoted to the floor. 
• Complete the downward range and hold for a moment then repeat.
fields.name: External Shoulder Rotation with Abduction Stretch - Supine, Side-Facing

fields.actionDescription:
• The involved arm position should be 90 degrees at the elbow with the hand facing up toward the ceiling.
• Gently allow the involved arm to fall out towards the camera while pivoting the movement around the elbow. 
• Do your best to maintain the elbow in contact with the ground let the involved arm rotate out till there is minor tension but no pain.
• Return to the starting position.
fields.name: External Shoulder Rotation Stretch - Supine, Side-Facing

fields.actionDescription:
• Gently move the involved arm up and across your body just below the chest line. 
• Use the other uninvolved arm to help facilitate the crossing stretch motion. 
• It is important to not go too far. 
• Hold for a few moments when you feel tension. 
• Return back to the starting position.
fields.name: Cross Chest Stretch - Supine, Side-Facing

fields.actionDescription:
• Lying on your back and side facing to the camera, align the involved side so that it’s closest to the camera. 
• The non-involved leg can be bent at that knee with the foot flat on the ground as displayed. 
• Maintain extension with the involved leg as you slowly bring it up toward the ceiling. 
• Pay close attention to your PT's or physician's protocol for height variance, and do your best to keep a strong extended leg at all times. 
• Move through the range of motion for a completion of a rep.
fields.name: Straight Leg Raise (SLR) - Supine, Side-Facing

fields.actionDescription:
• Wrap the theraband around both feet with your legs out in front of you. 
• If you are unable to straighten the legs all the way, just keep the heels pinned down to the ground. 
• Maintain an upright posture and pull the band toward you with the involved arm.
• Keep the elbow locked to the ribs and shoulder blades actively retracted. 
• Pull the theraband all the way in.
• Slowly release it back to the straight arm starting position for the completion of a rep.
fields.name: Row - Seated with Theraband (Single), Side-Facing

fields.actionDescription:
• Position yourself in front of a wall as the wall will be used to facilitate this movement.
• Climb the involved arm up the wall, while keeping the elbow and forearm as vertical as you can, to a place of tension but zero pain.
• Try your best to achieve a maximum range of motion but to move slowly and smoothly. 
• Return to the starting position for the completion of a rep.
fields.name: Wall Climb, Rear-Facing

fields.actionDescription:
• Begin with the arms at the side, elbows fully extended and palms facing inward toward your hips. 
• Start by moving the involved arm straight up toward the ceiling without breaking form at the elbow joint. 
• Maintain the position of the arm as you move through the movement. 
• Once full shoulder flexion is achieved, hold for a moment, then slowly return to the starting position.
fields.name: Shoulder Flexion - ROM, Side-Facing

fields.actionDescription:
• Stand tall with arms down at your side, and your palm facing in towards your hip.
• Slowly extend arm straight back, keeping elbow straight and trunk upright.
• Reach to the end of your available range of motion with minimal pain.
• Hold the position at max range till measurement is clearly given.
• Repeat the movement for 5 reps, and your measurement will be based on the best of 5 attempts.
fields.name: Shoulder Extension - ROM, Side-Facing
